H0.text: Galileo Galilei is credited with discovering the first four moons of Jupiter.

H1.text: Albert Einstein is credited with discovering the first four moons of Jupiter.

H2.text: Charles Darwin is credited with discovering the first four moons of Jupiter.

H3.text: Sir Isaac Newton is the scientist credited with discovering the first four moons of Jupiter.

A4.text: The Galilean moons were first observed by Galileo Galilei in either December 1609 or January 1610.

A5.text: Simon Marius discovered the moons independently at nearly the same time as Galileo, 8 January 1610.
